intro: Gomphia hookeri var. corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered gomphia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that are typically pale green or white. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
